contacts.title: Chief Information Officer
contacts.relevance_notes: Chief Information Officer since 2021. Owns IT strategy and clinical systems decisions at Fresenius Kidney Care. Key decision maker for EHR training technology investments and Epic implementation initiatives.

contacts.title: Vice President, Clinical Systems Strategies & Inpatient Clinical Initiatives
contacts.relevance_notes: VP since 2024, previously VP Inpatient Clinical Initiatives since 2020. BSN from Salem State, MS from UMass Lowell. Extensive clinical background with Brigham and Women's and Lowell General. Owns clinical systems strategy - key champion for EHR training initiatives.

contacts.title: Global Senior Director, Learning Design & Development
contacts.relevance_notes: Global Senior Director since 2023. Owns learning design and development globally. Previously Training Director at Fresenius since 2019. BS from Fitchburg State. Prior experience at Dassault Systemes, RSA, and Cadence. Direct owner of training program strategy and LMS decisions.

contacts.title: Senior Director, Clinical Education, Programs & Initiatives
contacts.relevance_notes: Senior Director Clinical Education since 2020. MBA, HCA, BSN, RN, CDN credentials. 13+ years at Fresenius progressing from Clinical Manager to Director of Operations to Clinical Education leadership. Owns clinical education programs and career pathways - key stakeholder for EHR training content.

contacts.title: Vice President, Technical Methods & Systems
contacts.persona_match: IT/Learning Technology Manager - Technical Methods Leader
contacts.relevance_notes: VP Technical Methods & Systems since 2015. DBA, MS from Troy University, BA from Saint Leo. 20+ years at Fresenius progressing from Division Director to VP. Owns technical systems strategy - key technical stakeholder for learning technology integration.

contacts.title: Director, Clinical Informatics
contacts.relevance_notes: Director Clinical Informatics since 2024, promoted from Clinical Informatics Educator role since 2015. BSN from Western Governors University. 16+ years at Fresenius/Azura Vascular Care including EMR Training Specialist role. Direct experience with EHR training delivery - understands training challenges firsthand.

contacts.title: Director, Information Technology
contacts.relevance_notes: Director IT since 2020, previously Senior Manager since 2017. 22+ years at Fresenius progressing from System Analyst to Director. Owns IT operations and systems implementation - key technical contact for integration and deployment discussions.

contacts.title: Senior Director, Clinical Quality Management
contacts.relevance_notes: Senior Director Clinical Quality since 2019. Bachelor from University of Pittsburgh, Master of Management from University of Phoenix. 25+ years at Fresenius including Clinical Manager and RN roles. Owns clinical quality programs - key stakeholder for compliance and competency verification.

contacts.title: Senior Director, Compliance
contacts.relevance_notes: Senior Director Compliance since 2022. BA from Marietta College, MSM from University of Akron. 8+ years at Fresenius with progression from Compliance Officer to Senior Director. Prior experience at DaVita and Gambro dialysis organizations. Key stakeholder for training compliance and regulatory requirements.

contacts.title: Director, Clinical Education
contacts.relevance_notes: Director Clinical Education since 2024. MSN, RN, CNN credentials. 15+ years at Fresenius progressing from RN to Education Coordinator to Senior Manager to Director. Bachelor's from Auburn, Master's from Capella. Direct clinical education practitioner now in leadership - understands trainer needs.

contact_summary.decision_maker_coverage: Strong - CIO, VP Clinical Systems, VP Technical Methods, Global Learning Director, Clinical Education Directors, Compliance Directors
contact_summary.recommended_entry_point: Jonathan Venable (CIO) - owns IT strategy including Epic implementation. Robin Collins (VP Clinical Systems) - owns clinical systems strategy and inpatient initiatives.

discovery_notes: Excellent contact coverage across all target personas. Jonathan Venable as CIO is the primary executive sponsor. Robin Collins as VP Clinical Systems is the key clinical champion owning systems strategy. Debra Vallone owns global learning design and development - direct influence over training technology decisions. Gina Allison leads clinical education programs. Carol Walker has direct EMR training experience. Multiple compliance and quality leaders identified for regulatory-driven training needs. Note: Stuart McGuigan (Global CIO at parent Fresenius Medical Care) not directly listed at Fresenius Kidney Care subsidiary.
